data.title: Not Bad.  Very Modern and New...
data.text:
Very updated rooms, very clean, a little modern for me (sort of like sleeping in an Apple Store) but nice.  Most comfortable bed I have ever had in a hotel room.  Amazing linens and a nice big TV.   Keurig coffee maker.

The only downside/complaint is there was no coffee set up that I could see in the morning, and I needed throat lozenges desperately and their little pantry is sort of a joke.  Like 6 candy bars and some deodorant.

Staff we wonderful, don't let my nitpicking stop you from staying here.  It's a beautiful property.

data.title: Heart of the capitol!
data.text: The staff was welcoming and friendly.  The room was very clean and nicely laid out.  I loved the Aveda bath products and the in-room coffee.  I would have liked an in-room hotel guide (paper version), but they did offer one on the television programming Guide.  Try 1 of their artisan cocktails at the bar for something a little different!

data.title: Excellent hotel in Downtown Albany
data.text: When visiting Albany for personal reasons, I have tried numerous hotels. All from very bad to good. Now I feel I have found the best. This renovated hotel is excellent. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was very spacious and clean. Beautifully decorated and bed very comfortable. Had only breakfast in restaurant but fine. I absolutely recommend this hotel if you are staying in Albany.

data.title: Lovely hotel!
data.text: This is a beautiful hotel in a historic building in Albany. They've done a wonderful job retaining some of the character of the original building (in the lobby, for instance), while incorporating modern elements. Our room was very modern, large and stunning, the bed was super comfortable and you had the option of watching Netflix right from the TV. The check-in and check-out processes were incredibly efficient and the staff was friendly. The on-site restaurant was also delicious (we enjoyed breakfast there), and our server was so kind and lovely. This hotel is very conveniently located, within walking distance of many Albany attractions, including the State Capitol and New York State Museum. It also seems like a very popular spot for weddings -- during our stay, we saw three wedding parties! Overall, this is a very nice hotel, and we would definitely stay here again on a future visit to Albany.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Renaissance Albany Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Sarah T,

Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback in regards to your recent experience with us at the Renaissance Albany. We appreciate your kind words in regards to our hotel, restaurant, and staff. It was a pleasure to have you as our guest and we hope to see you again in the future.

Sincereley,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Where to stay in Albany
data.text: I can't say anything definitive, so I'll suggest that this is *probably* the nicest hotel in downtown Albany.  The former DeWitt Clinton Hotel, this property steps from the NY State House was renovated in 2015.  The lobby and public spaces offer a sense of old hotel grandeur, while the rooms are impressively modern with clean lines and open space. Our king room as well-appointed with mesh and black our roller shades, a comfortable sitting chair, and a modern desk with chair.  The bed offered a comfortable rest after a long drive. Aveda bath products were a surprising perk. The only complaint was the a hushed but periodic rumble every few minutes that could have been caused by truck traffic or the hotel plumbing. If you opt-out of valet, parking is US$16 for a space in the parking tower that is attached to the hotel. Downtown feels a little dead after 6 on the weekday we were there, but we found a few places north east of the hotel.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Renaissance Albany Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Kevin D,

Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We appreciate your feedback and would like to thank you for your kind words. We would also like to apologize for the noise disturbance you experienced during your stay. We hope to see you again in the future when your travels bring you back to Albany.

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Renovated and Enjoyable
data.text: The recent renovation's are funky and modern (lots of neon), but there is a nice amount of old school hotel, especially in the lobby.  The rooms are large and well appointed.  The bathroom was almost too big. The lobby bar was great and had a nice crowd and the "healthy"" breakfast was surprisingly delicious.  Only stayed one night, but would definitely stay again when in town.

data.title: Nice hotel, central location, air conditioning much too loud
data.text: The hotel is very spacious. Rooms are big and clean. Furnishing modern. Fitness room perfect. Unfortunately the fresh air machine was very loud (I felt like beeing on a airplane) and could not be turned off :-(

data.title: Very nice and a little eccentric
data.text: Great place. Very clean. The lighting is a little different but also a neat. Very updated and modern feel  for such an old building. Great location right across the street from empire Plaza and the governors mansion. The staff was fantastic and the valet parking was an added bonus

data.title: Best hotel we've ever stayed in!
data.text: Spent a night here on our way back to NY.  We were blown away by this hotel.  We've stayed in over 100 hotels and this was one of the best!  The room was fabulous--very modern and top notch amenities.  My husband loved the bed--so comfortable.  And the restaurant downstairs was equally good.  Would recommend valet parking to avoid the hassle.  Walked across the street to tour the Capital Bldg.  Great location.

data.title: comfortable bed
data.text: Beautiful hotel, great location. Some of the front desk staff need customer service training, some are just rude and they're not good at following up with requests. Clean rooms, comfortable bed. Parking is reasonable $16/day.

If you would like to further discuss this issue, please feel free to reach out to me directly at 518-992-2500 as it would be my pleasure to assist you.

data.title: Beautiful Updated 1920s Hotel
data.text: A traditional downtown hotel near the state capitol building which has been updated in a very contemporary fashion.  Comfortable rooms with exceptional bathrooms.  Although thoroughly modernized, the owners retained the circa 1927 mural in the lobby depicting New York history.  Nice staff, although somewhat minimal in numbers. Convenient to downtown bars and restaurants.  Would stay again.

data.title: Fabulous Getaway
data.text:
Room was nice, however my wife said the lighting was poor. The bedding was VERY comfortable.
Had a wonderful dinner!!!

Parking was VERY cumbersome. Had to pay $20 for parking each night.

I would recommend this hotel for a nice overnight getaway

data.title: Excellent Hotel
data.text: We were in Albany NY on business and stayed at the Renaissance Hotel for the first time. The hotel is centrally located to the State Capitol complex and is across the street from the capitol's grounds, which is a large park and a pleasure to stroll through. The hotel was recently renovated with a modern interior style. Room was large and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Renaissance Albany Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beautifully updated hotel
data.text:
The hotel has been beautifully restored--I remember coming here to watch my parents dance in the ballroom. They have tastefully designed everything to blend old with new. The rooms are large and comfortable--loved that you could adjust the shower without getting wet! No bathtubs for those who like to soak.

Their restaurant is very slow--food has potential, but waitstaff is slow and slower. Our room was on the 4th floor--very noisy with thumping from wedding--our daughter-in-law and son were on the 11th and heard nothing, so advise a higher floor.

Attentive workers, excluding new waitress (waited 45 minutes for breakfast and had to chase her to get it). Not good.

Overall, beautiful hotel.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Renaissance Albany Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear gormlk,

Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Renaissance Albany. I would like to apologize for your breakfast experience in Wellington's as well as the noise disturbance you experienced. We hope to have another opportunity to better serve you when your travels bring you back to Albany.

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: amazing rooms
data.text: i think this hotel may have the biggest hotel rooms ever! modern, nice set up.  The bathrooms were nicely done with showers and there was great lighting. Will definitely return when in Albany.  Valet parking was a bit of a hassle but otherwise i don't have any complaints about this hotel at all.

data.title: My 'always' place when in Albany
data.text:
An absolutely gorgeously appointed hotel with wonderful service. After discovering this gem, I will stay no where else when traveling to Albany! The downtown location across from the Capital building is perfect, the restaurant is great, the rooms are magnificent and so clean with really comfortable beds and spacious bathrooms with Aveda bath products. And thankfully, I heard no noise outside our room. The little known free shuttle service was icing on the cake and so helpful, particularly since cab services are unreliable and (remarkably) Uber doesn't exist in Albany (as of this writing).

Count on it Renaissance Hotel...we'll be back!

data.title: Comfortable and relaxing
data.text: The Renaissance at Albany is in a great unbeatable location. The rooms are spacious and well furnished as well. The mattress was very comfortable and the blinds tight! All the staff here, from checkin to the bar, to valet, are all highly professional and helpful. Had a great time at the Renaissance.

owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A strong Marriott choice.
data.text: We stayed in a double-room on a family trip. The room was clean and well-appointed (though a bit small).  The bathroom was large but the toilet, sink and shower were all in the same space -- a problem for families.  The front desk staff was often overwhelmed.  The parking key cards failed four times during our 3 day stay.  The elevators were very, very slow.  The lobby, room and general decor were excellent. The room and air conditioner were quiet overall.  Generally speaking, an excellent hotel and far, far better than the Hilton a block away.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Renaissance Albany Hotel, responded to this review

I would like to apologize for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay but are happy to hear that overall you had a nice stay with us. We hope to see you again in the future should your travels bring you back to Albany.

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Unexpected!
data.text:
I was booked into the Renaissance for a business trip and honestly didn't read up on it before arrival.   I was expected an average hotel without a lot personality, and boy was I pleasantly surprised.

The hotel is situated in a historic building, but when on the inside, the vibe is decidedly modern.   The lobby and bar/restaurant  manage to pull off being modern and welcoming at the same time.   With just one exception, every single employee I came across was incredibly, friendly, helpful and genuine.   

While also very modern, the room doesn't have the same warmth as the lobby.  But it was very clean and bed very comfy.  I did find it rather dark however.   The bathroom was quite large and well appointed.

I had breakfast both mornings in the hotel restaurant.  The food was quite good, but  the service was a little slow for a business hotel.   Also had drinks one evening and during the week they offer a different free signature cocktail each evening, complete with a brief presentation about what is in it.  Fun idea.

They also offer a free transfer to the Albany train station, which is about 10 minutes from the hotel.

The hotel looks out over the state capitol building and couldn't be more conveniently located for business with the state.

I look forward to a return visit.  Keep up the good work.

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Modern feel in a Landmark building
data.text: We stayed at this property on the way to Montreal and loved our visit so much that on our way back we decided to stay again. The property is across the street from the New York State Capital building.   As you walk into the lobby you are meet with the wonderful structure and art of this landmark property.  The Renaissance has kept the Charm of this 1927 built building and added a modern flare.  The rooms are spacious, comfortable and the beds will put you in a deep sleep.  The staff is more than accommodating and friendly.
